author: O Dia
title: Brasileira recebe apoio de Hall da Fama para disputar título do UFC | | O Dia
text: Jéssica Bate-Estaca fará um duelo verde e amarelo no próximo sábado (7), contra Natália Silva (Foto: Reprodução) Pensando nisso, Bate-Estaca concedeu uma entrevista ao podcast "Trocação Franca" e declarou que, caso vença seu duelo, vai falar com Dana White e pedir uma disputa de cinturão, independente de qual for a categoria. A paranaense garantiu que aceita lutar pelo cinturões peso-mosca, peso-palha e até mesmo o cinturão "BMF" (lutador mais casca-grossa). O título "BMF" para mulheres ainda não existe, mas Jéssica já garantiu uma adversária para uma eventual disputa do simbólico cinturão: a ex-campeã e membro do Hall da Fama da organização, Joanna Jedrzejczyk, que deixou o MMA em 2022 e atualmente tem 37 anos. "Vou falar para o Dana White que não importa, pode ser no peso-palha, peso-mosca, pode ser o cinturão BMF, o que tiver disponível para mim eu quero. Eu quero uma disputa de cinturão. Eu já andei conservando com a Joanna Jedrzejczyk e ela disse que voltaria (da aposentaria) se fosse uma luta pelo cinturão BMF. Acho que seria uma boa luta. Se não, a Angela Hill, que não nega fogo para nada, ela está sempre lutando em tudo, ou a Valentina Shevchenko", declarou Bate-Estaca, que seguiu: "Qualquer uma dessas meninas seria muito bom, mas com a Joanna seria um ícone diferente. Eu iria fazer uma estratégia totalmente diferente. Ela já disse que não lutaria no peso-palha, mas sim no mosca, e para mim seria até melhor, porque é uma categoria onde eu me sinto muito bem e não iria ficar prejudicada com corte de peso. Acho que a gente faria um show, uma luta muito legal e eu ia descontar (a derrota sofrida para Joanna, em 2017)", finalizou a brasileira. Aos 32 anos de idade, Jéssica Bate-Estaca é ex-campeã peso-palha e atual quarta colocada do ranking da divisão até 52kg. A lutadora chegou à segunda vitória seguida na carreira ao derrotar Marina Rodriguez no UFC 300, em abril. Antes disso, a brasileira havia derrotado Mackenzie Dern no UFC 295, em novembro do ano passado, se recuperando de três reveses seguidos. Como profissional, a paranaense tem agora 38 lutas, com 26 triunfos e 12 resultados negativos.

author: Antonio Graceffo
title: Undersea Cables Latest Target of China's Hybrid Warfare Strategy
text:
In December, European officials launched an investigation into the sabotage of undersea internet cables in the Baltic Sea , allegedly severed by a Chinese-flagged vessel. Earlier this month, a similar incident near Taiwan centered around a Chinese vessel suspected of severing an undersea fiber-optic cable. The vessel in question was operating under multiple flags and identities in violation of international norms, likely in an effort to conceal its identity and obscure any links to Beijing. These incidents exemplify China’s use of “gray zone,” or hybrid warfare tactics—irregular, non-combat operations aimed at applying military pressure to adversaries, though pressure that falls short of eliciting a strong military response that could lead to open conflict.
Recent incidents involving undersea cables align with China’s broader hybrid warfare strategy, a calculated blend of military and non-military tactics designed to achieve geopolitical goals while avoiding direct confrontation. The targeting critical infrastructure such as undersea cables highlights China’s ability to disrupt communication networks, undermining Taiwan’s economic stability and national security. Apart from the physical damage, these acts send a clear psychological message, generating uncertainty and emphasizing the vulnerabilities of Taiwan and its allies.
The Chinese Communist Party (CCP) has an established record of employing hybrid warfare as a strategic tool to assert dominance and destabilize opposition. In the South China Sea, Beijing’s approach integrates political, economic, military, and societal tactics to advance territorial claims and consolidate control over disputed areas while avoiding direct conflict. Key elements of the strategy include leveraging nonmilitary forces, such as the coast guard and maritime militias , employing intimidation tactics like ramming, shadowing, near-collisions, and using military-grade lasers.

author: Hannah Eason Amado
title: Child sexual abuse lawsuit filed against Virginia Baptist church | 13newsnow.com
text: RICHMOND, Va. — Two sisters have filed multi-million dollar lawsuits against a Virginia Baptist church, claiming the church leaders did not stop sexual abuse by a youth group assistant. The women claim the abuse took place between 2006 and 2009, beginning when the women were 6 and 10 years old. Gerald R. Thomas, a now-convicted sex offender, is accused of grooming and sexually assaulting the girls on an almost weekly basis during church youth programs. The youth group operated at Bethany Place Baptist Church in North Chesterfield. It was acquired by Coastal Church, LLC in 2023 and was rebranded as Coastal Church – Bethany Campus. The church has multiple locations in Hampton Roads, including Chesapeake, Gloucester, Hampton, Williamsburg and Yorktown. Court documents list the church as being based in Yorktown. The sisters, who were not identified in court documents, said they were assaulted for years on church property and "often in full view of other staff and volunteers," according to a statement from the sisters' attorneys. "Despite multiple red flags and direct observations by Bethany Place leadership, no meaningful action was taken to protect the girls or remove Thomas from access to children," the statement said. The sisters claim that church leaders and volunteers witnessed Thomas engage in inappropriate behavior, including isolating the girls and inappropriately touching them in public settings. The lawsuits claim no internal reports were filed, and no steps were taken to remove Thomas. Thomas was arrested and charged in 2010 after one of the sisters reported the abuse to her school counselor, which prompted a mandatory investigation. He pleaded guilty to aggravated sexual battery in 2010 in cases involving both sisters, according to the sisters' legal counsel. Thomas was found guilty in 2020 of abusing a third underage victim. Bethany Place is accused of failing to implement protective policies, such as proper adult-to-child ratios, background checks, and prevention of one-on-one interactions between adults and children. The lawsuit claims the incidents came after warnings and national guidelines issued by the Southern Baptist Convention and the Centers for Disease Control. The lawsuits are demanding accountability on five claims: assault and battery, gross negligence and reckless disregard, breach of duty (including from a custodial relationship), negligent retention and vicarious liability. Each sister is seeking $50 million in compensatory damages and $100 million in punitive damages, citing years of emotional trauma, post-traumatic stress disorder. They also claim a loss of quality of life and earning capacity.

author: @Quadratin_Gro
title: Inicia Gobierno megacampaña de vacunación con 800 mil dosis en Guerrero
text:
ACAPULCO, Gro., 4 de abril de 2024.- Con el propósito de lograr una cobertura vacunal del 90 por ciento para proteger a la población de enfermedades infecciosas prevenibles por vacunación, se puso en marcha en territorio guerrerense la Campaña Nacional de Recuperación de Cobertura de Vacunación 2024.
De acuerdo con un boletín, la Secretaría de Salud Guerrero informó que del 1 de abril al 31 de mayo, a través del Consejo Estatal de Vacunación (COEVA), se pretende aplicar en la entidad 800 mil dosis de todos los biológicos a la población con esquema incompleto.
La meta a nivel nacional es aplicar 9 millones de dosis, con particular énfasis en los fármacos contra la poliomielitis (hexavalente), sarampión, rubeola y parotiditis (SRP), y sarampión y rubéola en adolescentes (SR), entre otras.
Cabe destacar que el 90 por ciento en cobertura de vacunación, es la cifra mínima indispensable para alcanzar la inmunidad necesaria que impida el resurgimiento de enfermedades transmisibles infecciosas como la poliomielitis, sarampión y rubéola.
La campaña de recuperación de esquemas de vacunación estará dirigida a personas rezagadas, personas que por alguna razón les haya faltado alguna dosis de vacuna, por lo que la dependencia de salud hace la invitación a revisar sus cartillas de vacunación y acudir a las unidades de salud a recibir los biológicos correspondientes.
Todas las vacunas son gratuitas, efectivas y necesarias para proteger a la población de enfermedades infecciosas prevenibles.

author: Decatur Daily Democrat
title: Medical Answering Service AI Paves the Path for Enhanced Healthcare Sector | News | decaturdailydemocrat.com
text: Amidst the ongoing digital revolution and the escalating prevalence of online presence, there is a notable surge in the demand for medical answering services. This surge has opened up new prospects for call service providers. However, the market is now saturated with subpar solutions, prompting healthcare professionals to seek a dependable medical practice answering service. Since its establishment in 1991, Medical Answering Services AI has been a trailblazer in the industry, consistently adapting to the evolving needs of healthcare practices. With over three decades of experience, it proudly introduces an innovative approach to medical call management designed to streamline operations, enhance patient care, and elevate communication standards within the healthcare sector. This groundbreaking service will reshape how healthcare providers engage with their patients, blending extensive experience with cutting-edge technology for a more efficient and promising future. In our recent discussion with the team, we will delve into their recent successes and explore valuable lessons that other companies can extract from their journey. Establishing Confidence: 14-Day Trial Period Understanding the critical importance of trust in healthcare services, the company emphasizes its commitment to excellence through a complimentary 14-day trial period. This trial serves as a concrete expression of the company's dedication to transparency and quality, providing medical practitioners with a firsthand experience of the positive impact of its services on their daily operations. The company aims to build trust with potential clients by offering this opportunity, showcasing efficacy and reliability. Established Reputation Since 1991 With a rich history dating back to 1991, the company has become a trusted nationwide medical practice answering service. Over the years, it has continuously adjusted to the evolving needs of the healthcare industry, positioning itself as a reliable and forward-thinking service provider. By staying abreast of industry developments, the company endeavors to provide its clients with top-notch service, nurturing lasting relationships founded on trust, reliability, and a shared dedication to advancing patient care. Emphasizing Clarity through Affordable Solutions A fundamental aspect of their mission is prioritizing transparency and accessibility in healthcare solutions. This commitment is demonstrated through their cost-effective offering – a medical answering service available at a flat monthly rate of only $69. This budget-friendly solution enables healthcare practitioners of all sizes to provide uninterrupted patient care without burdening their finances. The steadfast commitment to transparency ensures clients receive a valuable service without hidden costs or unexpected financial surprises. Dependable Support Around the Clock Recognizing the constant demands of the healthcare sector, the company functions as a 24/7 medical call center. This persistent service structure empowers them to address patient inquiries, manage appointment scheduling, and respond to emergency calls at any hour. This unwavering dedication to around-the-clock availability guarantees that your patients receive timely care, significantly enhancing healthcare delivery's efficiency and reliability. Assisting a Wide Spectrum of Healthcare Fields Acknowledging the multifaceted nature of healthcare, the company tailors its services to address the distinctive requirements of individual healthcare facilities. This customized approach guarantees a smooth and continuous patient experience for diverse healthcare professionals, from hospitals and pediatricians to OBGYNs, dentists, mental health practitioners, hospices, and specialists. By accommodating the unique needs of each sector, the company enhances the overall effectiveness and efficiency of healthcare delivery. Providing Precision through Accurate Call Routing Efficient triaging of incoming calls is important in healthcare operations. The system adeptly differentiates between urgent and non-urgent calls, prioritizing immediate attention for critical issues and appropriately handling non-emergent matters. This precise call routing minimizes unnecessary disruptions for medical staff, streamlining communication and enhancing the overall effectiveness of healthcare services. Ensuring Patient Privacy through a HIPAA-Compliant Strategy Medical Answering Service AI safeguards patient privacy and upholds data security. The company takes pride in providing a reliable medical practice answering service that adheres to HIPAA compliance, underscoring its dedication to this responsibility. This compliance guarantees the utmost security standards in handling sensitive patient information, creating an atmosphere of trust and confidence. Selecting the appropriate medical answering service is vital to ensure the seamless functioning of your medical practice. "The medical answering service we provide is 100% HIPAA compliant and completely secure. Our secure messaging service lets you and your patients rest easy, knowing that patient information remains safe. Ensuring all your systems and staff communication procedures are HIPAA compliant is key." Suite 105 City: Westerville State: OH 43081 Country: United States Website: https://medicalansweringservice.ai

author: MarketScreener
title: Health Care Up as Biotech Rebounds -- Health Care Roundup | MarketScreener
text:
Health care companies rose as traders rotated back into high-risk biotech firms.
Federal drug regulators missed the deadline for making a key decision regarding a Covid-19 vaccine from Novavax, days after the Food and Drug Administration's vaccine chief was pushed out.
Novavax ticked up, but remained deep in the red for the year to date. The Federal Trade Commission's lawsuit against three large pharmacy-benefit managers over insulin prices -- Cigna's Express Scripts, UnitedHealth Group's Optum Rx and CVS Health's CVS Caremark -- is on hold after President Trump fired two of the agency's commissioners.
Planned Parenthood is closing clinics and facing more financial strains as Republican control of Washington opens new avenues for weakening the abortion provider.
Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com
(END) Dow Jones Newswires
04-02-25 1741ET

author: admin3
title: Caso Marielle: PGR é contra soltura de irmãos Brazão e Rivaldo Barbosa
text:
A Procuradoria-Geral da República (PGR) enviou nesta quinta-feira (27) ao Supremo Tribunal Federal (STF) parecer para manter a prisão dos irmãos Domingos e Chiquinho Brazão e do ex-chefe da Polícia Civil do Rio de Janeiro Rivaldo Barbosa. Eles estão presos desde março deste ano pelo suposto envolvimento no assassinato da vereadora Marielle Franco e do motorista Anderson Gomes, em 2018.
No parecer, o vice-procurador Hidenburgo Chateaubriand afirma que os três acusados devem continuar presos. A custódia, segundo a PGR, é necessária para garantia da ordem pública e o andamento das investigações. O pedido de soltura foi feito ao Supremo pela defesa dos acusados.
Notícias relacionadas: Moraes abre novo inquérito para apurar assassinato de Marielle . STF torna irmãos Brazão réus pelo assassinato de Marielle .
“Esse quadro, em virtude do qual se justificou a decretação das prisões que os denunciados pretendem agora ver revogadas, não sofreu nenhuma alteração. Os elementos fáticos permanecem rigorosamente os mesmos, não havendo, portanto, motivo para que se desfaçam as decisões que foram, com base neles, proferidas”, argumentou o procurador.
O pedido para soltar os três acusados foi feito ao ministro Alexandre de Moraes, que é relator do caso. Segundo as defesas, não há perigo de fuga e medidas menos gravosas podem ser determinadas pelo ministro.
Na terça-feira (18), o Supremo transformou em réus o conselheiro do Tribunal de Contas do Rio de Janeiro (TCE-RJ), Domingos Brazão, o irmão dele, Chiquinho Brazão, deputado federal (sem partido-RJ), o ex-chefe da Polícia Civil do Rio de Janeiro Rivaldo Barbosa e o major da Policia Militar Ronald Paulo de Alves Pereira. Todos respondem pelos crimes de homicídio e organização criminosa.
